posts.html:
@Plum

That is not exactly how it works. They play a fetchland, say you activate tectonic on it, they sac in response. Also, you cannot tectonic in response to them using the fetchland, because sacrifice is part of the cost, there will be no fetchland on the battlefield for you to target at the point you gain priority. While these are good for hitting the tri lands, m10 duals, etc, they are NOT good against fetches.

4/5
Report Abuse

Posted By: True_Smog (2/7/2010 11:12:57 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
If you doubt this card at all you are an absolute idiot.  
This card can CRUSH a deck like Jund, or Grixis Control. UWR control really hates it, but they can work around it better than Grixis. You have problems if you don't see the significance of killing Jund's 4th turn land preventing their [Bloodbraid Elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodbraid Elf) from landing, or stopping Grixis from landing the turn 7 [Cruel Ultimatum](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cruel Ultimatum) it's aiming trying to land.  
Every deck out there has at least something this thing can hit. Even mono colored decks in standard run some sort of nonbasic land for one purpose or another. Boros, RDW, and WW all run fetch lands to pump their landfall creatures. When they play a fetchland turn 4 or later wait for them to tap their land and to sac it and then activate Tectonic Edge in response. Tectonic Edge resolves first and stops them from getting another land. So not only did you set them back a land, you stopped them from double pumping their creatures. Vamps run fetchla... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: AXER (1/31/2010 6:40:44 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@ Plum:  
  
This card is good, but not necessarily for why you say it is. Killing Jund's 4th land won't deny them the mana to cast the elf that turn. The destruction ability uses the stack, mana abilities don't. [Bloodbraid Elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodbraid Elf) still gets cast. The main beef of this card is killing off [Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle), hamstringing Valakut Ramp in terms of damage output, and also killing annoying man lands like [Celestial Colonnade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Celestial Colonnade), [Raging Ravine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Raging Ravine), and [Creeping Tar Pit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Creeping Tar Pit) (which itself is a countermeasure against planeswalkers).
posts.html:
@ Plum:

This card is good, but not necessarily for why you say it is. Killing Jund's 4th land won't deny them the mana to cast the elf that turn. The destruction ability uses the stack, mana abilities don't. Posted By: DacenOctavio (1/26/2011 4:05:35 PM)

posts.post_content: Before this was printed, half of the people on the forums lamented how this wasn't Wasteland, that LD is useless when they get to four lands, etc. etc. Now this is probably the single most played card in Standard, a 3- or 4-of in almost every deck, due to how important it is to be able to slow down control decks by a turn or two (and also to destroy Valakuts and the manlands). And Tectonic Edge does all these without spending one deck slot.
